name: radishes
text: God that is so sad

name: spinynorman
text: The crazy thing is how accurate this is. When you got depression/neuroses every time you screw up your head fills with dozens of little league moppets screaming obscenities at you through their endearingly chipped baby teeth.

name: norsef
text: Really? My neuroses sound like toads saying "Useless" or Lee Cornes.

name: awesomonster
text: Chubby for the Red Dwarf reference, my friend!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: They are ticky-tacky shits who grow up to live in ticky-tacky  McMansions. To hell with them.

name: mystkmanat
text: They're all made out of ticky-tacky and they all look just the same.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
That song was popular when I was your age.
With the 'whatever' of 4 decades that can pass like a blink, I can in all seriousness urge you to think and live likewise, outside the ticky-tacky box.

name: mystkmanat
text: I just started my senior year of high school a couple of days ago, and that is extremely relevant advice.  Fuck that ticky-tacky box!  I won't let you down, scorpio.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: yay for you mystkmanat!

name: shatneresque
text: Chubby for a fellow high school senior.

text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. text: Is it neccessary to post this every time Roast Beef has an episode?

name: selbencoirlo
text:
I am so confused. For a moment I thought this was feeble stammering followed by a forced admission that it is, indeed, fun to say that that dude comes from Circumstances. Instead it turned out to be the kind of playground harassment that contributed to those circumstances. I chuckled before realizing, and now I feel dirty and betrayed.
These are the everyday events that someday coalesce to become Circumstances.

name: lawbot
text: NO

name: lawbot
text: No.

name: sje46
text: No.

name: psquid
text: No?

name: arelladawn
text: A comment left by arelladawn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by CapnMurphy, Ariamaki, jezebel)

name: lolsworth
text: I genuinely believe it is, yes.

name: radishes
text: A comment left by radishes was marked as spam and excluded. radishes: What a douche. (reported by GeyserShitdick, Magb, wehavemagnums)

name: arcibi
text: I could go for some blue nehi right now

name: thegrayhoodie
text: Nice avatar arcibi

name: drskradley
text: I appreciate how you both use Eastman & Laird depictions of the famous terrapins, albeit one of them is a sculpture thereof.  Not saying I got beef with the 'toons, but I'm just showing my nerd chops.

name: cracklewater
text:
I've got a ragin' hardon of hate for the toons, if that's any help. Maybe we could average out our feelings and both simply loathe the animated version?

Foot clan 'robots' being slaughtered en masse? Bah.

That's as bad as the Spectra 'robots' in Battle of the Planets .

Come to think of it, I knew a Star Wars fan who insisted that Imperial Stormtroopers were robots. Kids today...

Then again, in my own ignorance (of US sugary treats), I didn't spot that it was Nehi that Mrs. Smuckles brought for the kids. I read it as 'Blue Nehl', which I thought could be an off-brand version of Blue Bols. It might have gone some way towards explaining Ray's passion for liquor.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
When I was about those kids' age, we had a kid in P.E. who was a midget. His nickname was Nehi.
He was a pretty okay dude, actually. Didn't take any other crap except what he had to take for being tiny.
Little guy sure tried.

name: aarongstock
text:
Yes, radishes....

It ranks among the harshest put-downs (must be clever to count).

name: deimosrising
text: Fived for "Like the doctor." The kid who dropped that one was pretty talented.

name: senseihollywood
text: I concur...healthcare related humor is pretty adavanced for little leaguers...

name: unfun
text:
I've got Samuel H. Invis-i-ble
Instead of a mom and a dad
He's nev-er taken me to the zoo
And I've nev-er seen a doctor

...He's Samuel!

name: catachresis
text:
From panels one and four you can tell that Ray wears the 99, which seems pretty accurate.
Also I never noticed before how Beef has no number and a crappy home-made hat.

name: gouldgonewild
text: I like that he is just wearing a white undershirt.

name: joeyramoney
text:
cigarettes, lottery tickets, malt liquor, and nail polish.
no, it does not appear that a baseball jersey is part of the Kazenzakis monthly budget.

name: jaldor
text: You forgot meth. That's like most of the budget.

name: woodenteeth
text: I thought you said "math" at first, and I was going to correct you saying math is also something that is not included in the monthly budget.

name: jackscolon
text: I like his excitement over coke AND pepsi.

name: atticusonline
text: haha you know he just yelled out the highest number he could think of

name: goatmasterflash
text: Oh, man. Thanks for pointing that saddest thing out. Made me notice how Beef's brim is flat as can be. This makes me want to go hang myself from the shower curtain rod now.

name: howl
text: Also, compare the letter on the cap to Ray's. Looks like Beef might have drawn his on.

name: selbencoirlo
text: That completely would not work. Use a door.

name: selbencoirlo
text: Unless you're tall. Then that won't work either.

name: epicurus
text: there have been those times.

name: clembot
text: notice how they lose the baseball game the second time

name: waldo913
text: Why yes.  Yes I did.

name: gouldgonewild
text: The dudes have no mercy.

name: boswelljn
text: poor poor poor Roast Beef. That's harsh.

name: cdl146
text: It's strips like this that make you wonder how Ray and Beef ended up being such close friends. It seems like even hanging out with Beef would have made Ray something of a pariah, yet you know they were close despite this.

name: phthoggos
text: Somebody says he's uncool, he'll just sit there bein' cool, and they'll be wrong.

name: ceres
text: Considering how well his associates munched, I'd say he could get away with a lot more than just being friends with poor Beef.

name: stormagnet
text: Having friend like Ray is probably what pulled Beef through.

name: neoboman
text: That last strip is horrifying...

name: neoboman
text: Whoops, meant panel (any Philippe strip is usually instant 5).

name: deancain29
text: thats rough on Beef

name: ham_shoes
text: Beef's pain is our gain.

name: joeyramoney
text: this strip is just pure, brutal pain.

name: hcaz
text: A comment left by hcaz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, rowboat, trout, amandulence)

name: aaron_haynes
text: Saddest thing.

name: joeyramoney
text: in the first panel, beef's speech bubble includes punctuation and is in a larger font.

name: twohundredninety
text: It looks like that speech bubble's pointing to number 14 to me -- the tail kind of hooks to the left at the tip.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Agreed.

name: stuart
text: God, have I been Ray.

name: ttagxamm
text: I'm pretty sure my folks forgot to pick me up from a Little League game once.  Might even have been the game where I hit a triple and the fat-ass volunteer dad coaching third base just said, "If youda dug it out you woulda had a homer."  Effing Little League.

name: leia
text: the fact that that is still with you really shows how one can be affected by such childhood experiences...

name: steerpike66
text: I think I hate Ray in this strip. 'Heh'.

name: woodenteeth
text:
You hate a guy because he's popular?

Maybe hate him because he didn't stick up for Beef.

name: riazm
text: Beef is the only one of the little leagers to have hair.

name: i_love_kate
text: The alt text for this strip may be the only ever mention of Pat's mother. And it may not even be true.

name: starman11
text: Pat has a mom?

name: bluecarrot
text: This was about to be a really cliche comic until the very last panel

name: dancinggollum
text: Is there a meaning to 7 14 62?  I feel like I might have seen that before.

name: goatmasterflash
text:
Absolutely, yes. 7 x 2 equals 14, and 62 is also a number. Good catch!

Har.

name: tourach3
text: slut-of-a-bitch has entered my vocabulary

name: stewieisgod13
text: Awww.... Poor Roast Beef!!! ;_;

name: rowboat
text: Rough chuckles.

name: dasuta
text: Well played.

name: chachibenji
text: Ray is the only cat with round ears here. Even his ears show that he has nothing to do with being on edge.

name: ham_shoes
text: He's an American Curl.  I'd post the link but I don't know bbcode.

name: direhaggis
text: Circumstances, Kazenzakis. Population: 1.

name: gopacapulco
text: should strips that make me really sad get low ratings?

name: archimedes2000
text: no, they develop the character and whatnot.

name: lux
text: If you notice, on Ray's day, the A's won by 7 runs. On Beef's day, they lost, with 0 runs. And a slightly darkened sky.

name: stagnantdisplay
text: How exactly do you pronounce "Orangina"? :P

name: goatmasterflash
text: On its own it rhymes with "Argentina". Combined with vodka, however, you get the VoGina, which rhymes with "queaf".

name: howl
text: Like "vagina," duh.

name: jabroniville
text: "Yeah, like a doctor!" One of the best anti-poor kid lines I've ever heard. Another one I once heard was "y'know... what's free." The insult-ee was smelly.

name: jabroniville
text: Sorry, meant to say "Y'know... water's free". The insult-ee was smelly.

name: henry_pussycat
text: Slut-of-a-bitch.

name: mullin
text: Astute baseball fans will note that the Achewood A%u2019s have an excellent run differential.

name: hendetta
text: Ray had to hit himself so hard on this day.
